DestroyLayout destroys a layout and all its contents so it can't be used any more. As a result, all memory occupied by these objects will be released.

See Also: @CreateLayout, @AddLayout
DestroyLayout.name: DestroyLayout

DisableTouch.desc:
Use this method to prevent any user interaction with the app.
You could use this for a safe mode for a slideshow.
DisableTouch.name: DisableTouch

DownloadFile.name: DownloadFile
DownloadFile.shortDesc: Download a file with Androids download manager

Error.desc:
Shows a detailed error message with message, file and line in an asynchroneous dialog. You can also set it to quit the app after the user dismisses the dialog.

See Also: @Alert
Error.name: Error

Execute.desc: Executes a piece of code asynchroneously to your program. It is designed for interacting with your main app from within a [WebView](CreateWebView.htm).
Execute.name: Execute
Execute.shortDesc: Execute js code from your app or a WebWiew

Exit.desc: With Exit you can cancel and completely stop the app. You can also forcefully **kill** the app by passing true as first argument.
Exit.name: Exit

ExtExec.name: ExtExec
ExtExec.shortDesc: Execute a bash script using Termux

ExtractAssets.desc: ExtractAssets allows to extract folders and files from your compiled APK to the local storage. But it works for local DroidScript projects as well. When override is false, already existant files will be kept and not overridden.
ExtractAssets.name: ExtractAssets
ExtractAssets.shortDesc: Extract app assets to a local directory

ExtractPlugins.desc:
ExtractPlugins overrides old plugin versions in the app's private folder with newer versions shipped with the APK.

This function is for debug purposes to forcefully update the plugins of an app even if the APK version did not change.
ExtractPlugins.name: ExtractPlugins

FileExists.desc:
FileExists Checks if a given file exists in your filesystem or not.

See Also: @WriteFile, @CopyFile, @RenameFile
FileExists.name: FileExists

FolderExists.desc:
Checks if a given folder exits or not.

See Also: @MakeFolder, @CopyFolder, @RenameFolder
FolderExists.name: FolderExists

GetAccessibility.desc: Returns information about the availability of several accesibility features on the device.
GetAccessibility.name: GetAccessibility

GetAccounts.desc:
Returns a string of all known account names on the device separated with comma ','.

See Also: @ChooseAccount
GetAccounts.name: GetAccounts

GetActivities.desc:
GetActivities returns a list of object of currently running activities.

See Also: @GetRunningApps, @GetRunningServices
GetActivities.name: GetActivities

GetAppName.desc: Returns the name of the current app.
GetAppName.name: GetAppName

Returns the path to the app assets folder. If it's a DroidScript project the path should be “/sdcard/DroidScript/appname” - If it is an apk it is “/Assets”

GetAppPath.name: GetAppPath

GetBatteryLevel.desc:
Returns the current battery level of the device in percent.

Returns the hexadecimal Bluetooth address of the device, following the pattern “00:00:00:00:00:00”.

Returns the Bluetooth name of the device.

GetBtProfileState.name: GetBtProfileState

GetBuildNum.desc: GetBuildNum returns the build number of an APK.

GetChargeType.desc:
Returns the current charge type. If the device isn't charging the result is “None”.

Returns the name of the device country (ie. “United Kingdom” or “Deutschland”)

Returns the code of the device country (ie. “GB” or “DE”)

Returns data stored via app.SetData(key, value). All data will be lost when the app is closed.

Returns the default Orientation of the device. The result modes can be “Portrait” if the device width is smaller than the device height, or “Landscape” vice versa.

Get the display width of the app in pixels. Therefore virtual buttons won't be included to the value.

GetFileDate.desc: GetFileDate returns a Date object containing the last modified date of a file or folder.

%c

GetAppLanguages.desc:

GetAppLanguages.name: GetAppLanguages

GetLanguageCode returns the user language code (ie. “en” or “de”).

GetLanguageCode.name: GetLanguageCode

GetNotifyId.name: GetNotifyId

Returns the current device orientation. The result modes can be “Portrait” if the device width is smaller than the device height, or “Landscape” vice versa.

GetOrientation.name: GetOrientation

Returns the id of a resource.

Returns the current rotation of the device around it's Z-Axis in 90 degree steps. The values are relative to the initial orientation of the device on startup.

Returns a list of objects containing info about all currently running services in the background.

Returns the total screen width of the device in pixels. With the 'Real' **option** softkeys will be included in the value.

GetScreenWidth.name: GetScreenWidth

Forces the screen to turn off and puts the device to sleep. (This has the same effect as pressing the power button)

Hides a previously shown progress bar dialog.

HideProgressBar.name: HideProgressBar

Multiple parameters are available using pipes:
	“param1=value1|param2=value2”

pTypes: str-GET:retrieve data|POST:submit data|JSON:post json data|PUT:replace target resource|DELETE:deletes the resource|HEAD:omit body

Let the user install a device wallpaper located in the 'Wallpaper.js' script in the project root folder.

<premium>

See also @CreateWallpaper.

Return whether bluetooth was enabled.

IsBluetoothEnabled.name: IsBluetoothEnabled

IsBtDevicePaired.shortDesc: Check bt paired state to other device

IsCharging.name: IsCharging

IsChrome.shortDesc: Check if device OS is ChromeOS

IsKeyboardShown.name: IsKeyboardShown
IsKeyboardShown.shortDesc: Check whether device keyboard is shown

pTypes: bin||str-Full:Device can sleep, Screen and Keyboard on|Partial:CPU always on, Screen and Keyboard off
PreventScreenLock.shortDesc: Prevent screen from locking after some time

PreventWifiSleep.desc:
Prevent the device WiFi from powering down.

See Also: @SetWifiEnabled, @IsWifiEnabled
PreventWifiSleep.name: PreventWifiSleep

QueryContent.name: QueryContent
QueryContent.shortDesc: Queries content from the android content model

Quit.desc: Quits the app with showing an @Alert dialog box before exiting. The function will pause the program and exit before any further commands can be executed.

Quit.shortDesc: Quit the app with showing a dialog and exit after closing

ReadFile.desc:
Reads a file from the local filesystem and returns its contents.

See also: @WriteFile
ReadFile.name: ReadFile
ReadFile.shortDesc: Read the content of a local file

RedirectAssets.desc: Reads the assets folders “Img”,“Snd”,“Html” and “Misc” from an external folder outside the apk.

RemoveDrawer.desc:
Removes a drawer layout from a given side.

RemoveLayout.desc:
Removes a layout added to the app.

See also: @AddLayout
RemoveLayout.name: RemoveLayout

RenameFile.desc:
Renames a file on the local filesystem. This method can also be used to move a file to a whole other destination.

See Also: @WriteFile, @CopyFile, @DeleteFile
RenameFile.name: RenameFile
RenameFile.shortDesc: Rename or move a local file

RenameFolder.desc:
Renames a folder on the local filesystem. This method can also be used to move a folder to a whole other destination.

See Also: @MakeFolder, @CopyFolder, @DeleteFolder
RenameFolder.name: RenameFolder
RenameFolder.shortDesc: Rename or move a local folder

ReplaceInFile.desc: Replaces all occurances of some text or a regex pattern in a local file with some other text.

SaveBoolean.desc:
Save a boolean value to remember varibale values between multiple app starts.

See also: @LoadBoolean.

SaveBoolean.shortDesc: Save a boolean value across multiple starts

SaveCookies.desc:
Saves cookies for webviews or html apps.

See also: @ClearCookies
SaveCookies.name: SaveCookies

SaveNumber.desc:

See also: @LoadNumber.

SaveText.desc:
Save a text value to remember varibale values between multiple app starts and updates.

See also: @LoadText.
SaveText.name: SaveText
SaveText.shortDesc: Save a text value across multiple starts

ScanFile.desc:
Forces android to scan an image file to appear in the phone's gallery.

See also: @CreateImage, @CreateCameraView, @ScreenShot.
ScanFile.name: ScanFile
ScanFile.shortDesc: Adds media files to phone gallery

Takes a screen shot of your app and saves it to the specified path. Quality is an **option**al percentage value for jpg files defaulting to 95.

See also: @GetMediaFile
ScreenShot.name: ScreenShot
ScreenShot.shortDesc: Take a screen shot of your app

Script.desc:
Loads a local JavaScript file synchronously to your app to make its functionality available in your app.

See Also: @LoadScript
Script.name: Script

SendMessage.shortDesc: Send message from Service to main app

SendSMS.desc:
Send an SMS to someone using the default SMS application. The passed argumets will be auto-filled or requested by the SMS app otherwise. %c

See Also: @SendMail, @SendText, @SendFile
SendSMS.name: SendSMS
SendSMS.shortDesc: Open the SMS app and autofill fields

SetAlarm.desc: Set a time when you want your app to start automatically if it is not already opened. When the alarm is fired, the global _OnAlarm_ event will be fired.

pTypes: str_com-ExactIdle|Exact:only works for single shot alarms,App:Opens main app if called from a service
SetAlarm.shortDesc: Set alarm to open your app at a specific time

SetAutoBoot.desc:
Causes the current running APK or its Service to be started automatically when your device boots.

See Also: @SetAutoStart
SetAutoBoot.name: SetAutoBoot

SetAutoStart.desc:
Set a DroidScript project name which will be launched automatically when DroidScript starts.

See Also: @SetSharedApp, @SetAutoBoot
SetAutoStart.name: SetAutoStart

The SetClipboardText method puts text data on the device clip board. This allows you to copy and paste text between different applications.

See Also: @GetClipboardText
SetClipboardText.name: SetClipboardText

Saves variables until the app closes. All saved data will be lost afterwards. %c

See Also: @GetData, @ClearData
SetData.name: SetData
SetData.shortDesc: Save data while app is running

Changes the dpi value (dots per inch) that affects the content of any control created afterwards. The smaller the value, the smaller the scaling.

See Also: @GetScreenDensity

SetInBackground.desc:
Set the current service to run in the background.

SetInForeground.desc:
Set the current service to run in the foreground.

See Also: @StartSevice, SetInBackground
SetInForeground.name: SetInForeground

<premium>
<xfeature>

SetAppLanguage.desc:
Loads the current language code from the lang.json file in your project root folder. Make sure you use the [standard 2 letter language codes](http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php).

See Also: @GetAppLanguages

SetAppLanguage.shortDesc: Load the language code from lang.json

SetLanguage.desc:
Loads the current language code from the lang.json file in your project root folder. Make sure you use the [standard 2 letter language codes](http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php).<deprecated Use @SetAppLanguage instead>

See Also: @GetLanguage
SetLanguage.name: SetLanguage
SetLanguage.shortDesc: Load the language code from lang.json

SetMenu.name: SetMenu

Emulates a GPS location on the device.

<premium>
SetMockLocation.name: SetMockLocation

SetOnBroadcast.desc:
Define a callback function for incoming Broadcast messages.
You can find [a list of broadcasts available for android SDK ver. 28 here](https://chromium.googlesource.com/android\_tools/+/refs/heads/master/sdk/platforms/android-28/data/broadcast\_actions.txt)


See also: @Broadcast

See also: @Error
SetOnError.name: SetOnError

Define a callback function to detect when the WiFi connected state has changed. The **state** parameter can be “CONNECTING”, “CONNECTED”, or “DISCONNECTED”. The WiFi ssid is passed on “CONNECTED” only.

pTypes: str-px|dip|sp|mm|pt|pl:scales text in proportion with device resolution|ps:scales text in proportion with device resolution

<premium>

SetWifiEnabled.name: SetWifiEnabled

You can find the complete list of key names on the [Android Developer Page](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent#KEYCODE_0)
SimulateKey.name: SimulateKey

Start.desc: Starts your DS app in an html project. Call it in the document.onload function in order to initialize DroidScript and execute your OnStart() function.

StartApp.desc:

See Also: @StopApp

pTypes: str_com-Portrait|Landscape,Transparent,NoDom,Debug:start app in debug mode,Game:runs in GameView mode|remote
StartApp.shortDesc: Starts an app in a new window

StopDebugServer.name: StopDebugServer

pTypes: str-log:logs output to console,noread:dont read result (just execute),sh|su

Brings the app back to the foreground.

UnlockDrawer.name: UnlockDrawer

Unpairs a paired Bluetooth device by its bt address. The _callback_ argument is called when the device was successfully unpaired.

Uri2Path.name: Uri2Path

Makes the device vibrate in a specified pattern in millisecond values:
“pause:num\_mls,play:num\_mls,pause:num\_mls,play:num\_mls,...”
